alert.note: Alert for Lamar; Marion (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 15 at 12:27PM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Marion and southern Lamar Counties through 100 PM CDT... At 1227 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Sandy Hook, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Baxterville around 1240 PM CDT. Lumberton around 1250 PM CDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 400 PM CDT for south central and southeastern Mississippi.
